title: Cutpurse Twisted Fate for Colorblind People
body: I am colorblind. When I am against cutpurse twisted fate it is extremely difficult for me to tell gold card from red card. I have to squint and specifically concentrate above tf's head for a good second or two. This can be quite frustrating when playing against this skin even though it isn't that common. It would be awesome if you guys could touch this up like you did Tahm's grey health. Thanks!

replies.body:
Hey The Shadow Isles,

Thanks for reporting this! We've verified that this is an issue (especially with the icons on the cards looking a tad similar, as compared to the base). We'll see what we can do to make this a bit more colorblind-friendly. ^-^

How about that, Putting a letter in the center of card:

Blue Card: Big "M" Letter (Mana)
Red Card: Big "A" Letter (AOE)
Yellow Card: Big "S" Letter (Stun)

Eww, NO.

There just needs to be simple color-blind options;  That's it.  That's all that is needed

Related to TF, can you make Underworlds Twisted Fate Q's easier to see

It's borderline a pay 2 win skin with how difficult it is to see
On an unrelated note, why did the Valor icon on the minimap get replaced with Quinn's? Sometimes I cancel my ult because I see myself as Quinn and think I'm not ulting.
Quinn & Valor are not the same person, Riot decided, so when Quinn is ulting it's Valor carrying her, not her turning into Valor. Thus, there's no reason for the icon change.
Still though, It's really lame for Valor to not be recognized for the fact that he's hauling Quinn's lazy bum across the map at incredible speeds.
if you can't take a millisecond to look at your ult to see if it's active then that's the issue not the minimap lol

**UPDATE:** 

Hey! 

Sorry this has taken so long. D: 

Okay, so! You should see this change in Patch 6.5. 

Basically what we did was make some changes in brightness to the cards (like pushing the yellow to more yellow, as opposed to yellowish gold), as opposed to changes with saturation and hue, and as opposed to changing the icons on the cards ('cause they're pretty rad).

We shot this over to one of our dude in house who is also colorblind, and he said these are much more distinguishable. I'd be curious to hear your thoughts as well! 

http://imgur.com/OcCvBdj

In addition to this, I am colorblind, and I have a really hard time seeing the wild cards on Underworld Twisted Fate. I know I am not the only person who has complained about this. Is it possible you can make the cards on that skin easier to see?

This one may be a bit trickier because the color itself isn't as clear cut as these cards. There's also a ton of variations of color blindness, and unfortunately, we aren't able to adjust to all of them. D:

Buuuut, lemme talk to the team and see if/what we can do here. :]

Would it be possible to have it so when we turn on colorblind mode, it just shows the standard particle colors? That might save a lot of time in changing the entire skin to help a small group of us ><

Potentially, yes! 

I'm talking to the team today about what the options are.

I'm not colorblind and I think it's a bit hard to see, so it may be best to fix it across the board. We're talking about how to resolve this in a few ways 'cause one of the things to keep in mind is, the skin's been out for a while, and when we change content a player owns, it can be a touchy case - i.e. with the texture rebalances. 

I can update this thread when I have more info - hang tight!

I'm NOT color-blind and I still have a hard time with Underworld TF's particles. Howling Abyss is extra-bad in that regard, though I understand that the skins team doesn't really care about that map as much.

It's not that we don't care, skins are just primarily balanced to Summoner's Rift, as that's the main map. That said, we are looking into potential changes for these cards 'cause even on SR, it's not great.

Oh! As an example for something we *did* change based on HA readability - Koi Nami's white chroma was impossible to see originally in the HA brush. ;_; We added a bit more color to that chroma to make her a bit easier to pick out!

Should be on PBE today, and potentially swapped to live this patch. The disable for Cutpurse Twisted Fate was due to an error with the change. :c 

**TL;DR** - darker cards when they're not the highlighted card, and the hues were changed to the true value - i.e. yellow, as opposed to yellow-gold. 

For Soraka, it may be a hue difference. For example - Underworld Twisted Fate and Kalista share similar colors, but Kalista has brighter coloring (it's hotter in terms of color), so there isn't an issue for most people. Like you've mentioned, the glow and outline also usually help in cases where colors may affect readability in colorblind scenarios. 

That said, we're totally working on adjustments for Underworld Twisted Fate, too, 'cause the cards aren't easy to see, whether you're colorblind or not.
